title: Python shared object file not found

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I have the following configuration (`~/.spack/packages.yaml`) for using an existing installation of Python:
```
packages:
  python:
    externals:
    - spec: python@3.7.3
      modules: [python/3.7.3]
```
When I try to install `py-numpy` using:
```
$ spack install py-numpy%intel@19.0.3 ^python@3.7.3
```
I get the following error message
```
==> No binary for py-numpy-1.20.1-cqq3qwdmz2cjaxa3g5ri5jdmru44hrlg found: installing from source
/local/software/python/3.7.3/bin/python3.7: error while loading shared libraries: libpython3.7m.so.1.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 127:
    '/local/software/python/3.7.3/bin/python3.7' '-c' 'from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_var; print(get_config_var('"'"'LIBDIR'"'"'))'
/local/software/python/3.7.3/bin/python3.7: error while loading shared libraries: libpython3.7m.so.1.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
The module file `python/3.7.3` configures `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` to point to the shared object file. Using the `--dirty` flag doesn't raise this error message when the module file `python/3.7.3` is loaded.
